topic.title: Kiwipedia
topic.body:
Let this be a discussion topic for Kiwipedia.

[Git Center](/13c2MpR9ztCzVm7r8cTfV9h9FFEEiQ6AKD)
[GitHub](https://github.com/imachug/Kiwipedia)

Kiwipedia will have an ability to import articles from wikipedia.org and to create local articles.

1516747933_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body: Just a side note: [Poster](https://github.com/grez911/poster) is another cool blog platform.

1516750041_1EmrB8xSDYobVFSc3Kad1vx1EPaPR.body:
I didn't understand if ZeroWiki or ZeroMe was meant, but here goes.

For ZeroWiki, I am developing a new system with merged sites, comprasion, etc.

For ZeroMe, hashtags is a good idea.

> [kaffie](#comment_3_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Are you working on both ZeroWiki and ZeroWikipedia? ZeroWikipedia, as I understood it, is supposed to be an attempt to mirror wikipedia onto zeronet. Whereas ZeroWiki is meant to be a native approach towards building a wiki on zeronet, that isn't an exact clone of wikipedia.

I am developing *only* ZeroWikipedia, but ZeroWikipedia will have all the features ZeroWiki has, including creating articles in ZeroNet.

> [kaffie](#comment_5_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): So how do you plan to differentiate the wikipedia pages from the ones created/edited on zeronet?

There will be a notice. See here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1516596886_1KNSf9nhRFUc52aeX947CRwWTUGPPnZdyQ/Can+we+put+Wikipedia+on+0net

> Articles (to be specific, their versions) will be either imported or local.
> 
> Articles that have local version but not imported will have You are viewing an article from ZeroNet. If there is a Wikipedia version, you can [import] it here message and ZeroNet version will be shown on standard address (/wiki/en/article).
> 
> Imported articles with local versions will show local version by default: You are viewing an article from ZeroNet. Check out [ClearNet version]. on standard address. /imported/en/article can be used to directly view Wikipedia.org version.
> 
> Imported articles with no local versions will have This article was imported from [en.wikipedia.org].
> 
> Unexisting articles will have a button import and create.

1516818749_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [putsan](#comment_1_1MrESi8JYQqWEVbuRiGE8d41z29PmpT8GT): Import is already working? How to import if it works?

This isn't even beta, it is alpha. I've started developing it two days ago. But creating hubs is finished, adding articles (no editing yet, though) and viewing them is done. So in a week or so I will release.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_9_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Internal error: Exception: Merger site (Kiwipedia) does not have permission for merged site: 17FjMvAGAWAHxUohzk5HEq5EgjoCXnXV19 (None)UiWebsocket.py line 217 > MergerSitePlugin.py line 150 > MergerSitePlugin.py line 127 > MergerSitePlugin.py line 40

Try to download 17FjMvAGAWAHxUohzk5HEq5EgjoCXnXV19 manually first. It leaks peers.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_10_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Yes, that worked when i visited that en hub address directly and then i am able to access it -> "You are viewing hub en", "Welcome to English hub of Kiwipedia." I tried to import Freenet and It worked. Though got message "Content publish failed." [...]

When you visit that `Freenet`, it works, right?

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_11_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): yes, i see that page, same as page "ZeroNet"

It doesn't for me. Try to import that page once again by pressing `reimport` button right after title - I am sure there is a bug when you create data.json for the first time - though I thought I fixed it.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_12_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): I clicked the "refresh" kind of icon and it seems it initiated reimport and then appeared COntent published to 0/5 peers. Then appeared: Content publish failed.

Hm... Did you do it on `en` hub? Also can you send me your `data.json` and `content.json` please?

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_13_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): The address of that article is: /imported/en/https-en-wikipedia-org-wiki-freenet/freenet

That's correct. So I'm still interested in data.json and conntet.json in `/17FjMvAGAWAHxUohzk5HEq5EgjoCXnXV19/data/users/auth_address`.

> [belly](#comment_2_1KNSf9nhRFUc52aeX947CRwWTUGPPnZdyQ): I am amazed by your work! Absolutely stunning! Import works well. When this gets mathematic formulas and pictures it will be a scalable and real alternative to wikipedia!

It currently has `{{external media|image1=ExternalURL}}` template support. Local images are planned.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_15_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): this tutorial is hard to read/understand, i assume it is meant for programmers.

> [graph](#comment_1_1ENrYUYUHj6DcykKxnJmTJTppdQEwMPgSM): Thanks for the link! I was looking for something like that.

Yeah, currently only Kiwipedia developers are allowed to create templates, but soon this feature will be added for non-developers. You will be able to create new templates by creating page `Template:templatename` and using standard wiki markup there.

1516741810_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
> [balancer73](#comment_1_1PniNzyi8fygvwyBaLpA9oBDVWZ5fXuJUw): I am now slowly and with low priority working primarily in the direction of importing / exporting data from ZeroTalk. Did in the past broadcast external data (RSS, blog posts) in ZeroBlog. But stopped because of the fact that very large volumes are obtained, it is necessary to think over the ideology of cleaning unnecessary data, etc. [...]

I am working on ZeroWikipedia, so I'll try to add comments, too.

1516747912_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
> [mnemonic](#comment_15_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): Starting to play with the code, any idea on how to compile it the coffee + js files?

Run zeronet with `--debug` option.

1517087760_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
> [nekololi](#comment_5_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): me too! it points to Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit. i don't know how .bit addresses work but there must be a thing in your content.json or your user.json or something

@menmonic: Remove `domain` from `content.json`.

> [mnemonic](#comment_24_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): Updated, can I get you to test it out a little? We can start tracking updates there I think.

Looks wonderful!

> [mnemonic](#comment_25_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): I could still use some guidance on what to commit to repo / when so that I don't have to commit the data there and keep it clean, but so far happy with the result this week.  [...]

Yeah, I'll read it right now.

I am getting

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'title' of undefined
    at TopicList.applyTopicData (all.js?lang=ru:1405)
    at Object.Page.cmd (all.js?lang=ru:1644)
    at ZeroTalk.onMessage (all.js?lang=ru:1132)
```

> [mnemonic](#comment_26_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): Maybe I needed to re-publish it or something.. let me know if its working now.

Still nothing. Looks like that post doesn't exist at all.

> [mnemonic](#comment_27_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): Re-published the content and cleaned up the data from content.json now. Can you retry? [...]

Is 1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE your ID?

> [mnemonic](#comment_28_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): Its typed in identity address in the sidebar, but I have no clue if its correct/mine or not.

Yeah, it's yours then. My client says that file `data/users/1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE/data.json` is missing. Sign&publish `data/users/1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE/content.json` from sidebar please.

> [mnemonic](#comment_30_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): I think I'll just let the user edit their comment in the new comment box or do something to make it work at some point. Now I need to get the hang of the file management, which I am not making progress at since it says no peers. Any ideas?

Add data directory to .gitignore.

> [mnemonic](#comment_31_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): I did, which removed the files (I could do rm --cached in one directory but the other directory's data, where I publish from, was wiped).

You should never rm --cached.

> [mnemonic](#comment_33_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): I can no longer publish the content, do you know of someone who might be able to help with this?

> do you know of someone who might be able to help with this

I know. Ask @gitcenter.

So, now the answer: backup your site and privatekey, stop ZeroNet, remove any info about 1Hive8oUEeJeheQBLui2zgAxRq7hDasyEW from users.json and sites.json, restart ZeroNet, open http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Hive8oUEeJeheQBLui2zgAxRq7hDasyEW/.

> [mnemonic](#comment_34_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): Reply

Okay. I think that will help you because it helped me.

> [mnemonic](#comment_36_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): It tries to submit it for a minute or so and says the content is still in sync and asks if I want to write anyways and if I say I do, it "works".

Stop ZeroNet. Backup directory. Remove directory. Remove the site from users.json and sites.json (preserve the private key, though). (optional, if it doesn't work w/o this, try w/ this) Download SQLite Studio, open content.db from ZeroNet/data/content.db, find ID of site in `site` table, remove any `site_id = {thisid}` from all other tables. Restart ZeroNet. Download the site (not copy). Restore directory (or only a part, `data`). Sign & publish all files.

1517380880_1LTNeHLX2niwZ1Qsucq8YEe9Zwkvb.body:
> [nullpointer](#comment_2_1LTNeHLX2niwZ1Qsucq8YEe9Zwkvb7b4pw): Thanks, bro

And thank you for mentioning CodeR and Git Center!

1517355233_1Cz74bvSRgWqHaLCBUTrJPW7uvKyr.body:
> [wellan](#comment_1_1Cz74bvSRgWqHaLCBUTrJPW7uvKyr8P8RC): I don't know if I will find time and motivation for that, but it would be nice to create a browser game with economy, maybe resources, and long term fight to see how it can scale with optimizations. When the project will be more mature, I will probably explain how to use the API so people can build things with it.

You have `Math.random` in your source - I assume that is just for test, because otherwise all peers will see different content.
